source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers Accidental Death, Permanent Disablement and Third Degree Burns.

Coverage includes specified Amateur Sports like tandem skydiving, hang-gliding, paragliding, snow-skiing, hot-air ballooning, bungee jumping, indoor rock climbing and trekking up to 3,500m above sea level for all mountains.

Covers outpatient and hospitalisation medical expenses incurred overseas arising from accident or sickness, emergency dental expenses arising from accident, and accidental miscarriage. Includes treatment by specified practitioners.
Overseas coverage up to $1,000,000, including Chinese Physicians and Chiropractors.

coverages.coverage_name: Medical Expenses Incurred Upon Return to Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers follow-up treatment within 31 days from return date. If initial treatment was not sought overseas, treatment in Singapore must be sought within 48 hours from return date and is covered for up to 31 days. Includes treatment by specified practitioners.

coverages.coverage_name: Emergency Medical Evacuation & Repatriation (Including Mortal Remains) Back to Singapore

base_limits.type: Per Insured Person - up to 70 years
Per Insured Person - up to 70 years (Pre-existing Conditions)
Per Insured Person - above 70 years (Pre-existing Conditions)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers costs for emergency medical evacuation or repatriation of mortal remains back to Singapore. Includes pregnancy-related complications and pre-existing medical conditions subject to specific limits.
Includes pregnancy-related complications and pre-existing medical conditions.
Payable for each complete day the insured person is hospitalised overseas as an inpatient.

coverages.coverage_name: Double Hospitalisation Allowance Whilst Overseas in ICU Arising from an Accident

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Payable for each complete day the insured person is confined to an Intensive Care Unit (ICU) overseas due to an accident. This benefit is payable in lieu of the Overseas Hospitalisation Allowance (Section 5).

coverages.coverage_name: Hospital Allowance for Hospitalisation in Singapore

base_limits.basis: $50 per day for first 3 days, $150 per day for next 7 days

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Payable for each complete day the insured person is hospitalised in Singapore upon return, related to an injury or illness sustained overseas.
Covers additional accommodation and travel expenses incurred on written medical advice by a qualified medical practitioner as a result of the insured person's accident or sickness overseas.

coverages.coverage_name: Guardian for Return of Dependent Children

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays reasonable travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to travel to the insured person and accompany any unattended dependent child(ren) back to Singapore, in the event of the insured person's hospitalisation overseas.

coverages.coverage_name: Compassionate Visit by a Relative or Friend

base_limits.type: Per Insured Person - Due to injury, sickness or disease
Per Family - Due to injury, sickness or disease
Per Insured Person - In the event of death
Per Family - In the event of death

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers reasonable travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to travel to the insured person if hospitalised overseas for a specified period, or to arrange for repatriation in the event of death.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or Damage to Baggage & Personal Effects

base_limits.type: Any one article or pair or set of articles
Video equipment, camera, batteries and lenses (per article)
Laptop computer or tablet device (either one)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss or damage to baggage, clothing, personal effects, and portable electronic/computer equipment belonging to the insured person. Section (A) limits apply for the Elite tier. Specific sub-limits apply per item/category.

base_limits.type: Loss of money resulting from theft
Fraudulent use of credit card overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers costs of replacing lost/stolen travel documents (passport, visa, tickets) and loss of cash or traveller's cheques due to theft or burglary. Includes cover for fraudulent use of credit/charge cards. Section (D) limits apply for the Elite tier.

Covers loss of irrecoverable travel deposits or charges paid in advance due to necessary cancellation or postponement of the entire trip arising from Insured Events occurring within 30 days before departure.
Includes coverage for loss of frequent flyer or similar travel points used to purchase an airline ticket.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 2, Trip Cancellation or Postponement Highlight

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss of irrecoverable prepaid travel costs and additional travel expenses incurred if the trip is cut short due to Insured Events, resulting in return to Singapore.

base_limits.type: Loss of un-utilised portion of prepaid travel costs/expenses - Per Insured Person
Loss of un-utilised portion of prepaid travel costs/expenses - Per Family
Cash benefit for un-utilised paid ticket cancellation - Per Insured Person

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss of un-utilised portion of prepaid travel costs and expenses whilst overseas due to Insured Events. Also pays a cash benefit for un-utilised paid event tickets cancelled as a result of Insured Events.
Up to $100 coverage for unused event tickets.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 1 & Page 2, Trip Disruption Cover Highlight

coverages.coverage_name: Financial Collapse of Licensed Tour Operators

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss of non-refundable or un-utilised prepaid travel costs and expenses for trip cancellation or curtailment due to the financial collapse of the licensed tour operator, occurring after the policy issue date.
Covers legal liability for accidental bodily injury to third parties or accidental loss/damage to third party property arising during the trip.

base_limits.basis: $200 for 1st full 6 hours (overseas) or $150 for 1st full 6 hours (Singapore), $125 per full 4 hours thereafter (overseas)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a cash benefit for delay in arrival of checked-in baggage for specified durations. Extended to cover delay if baggage is wrongly picked up by another passenger overseas.

base_limits.basis: $100 for 1st full 6 hours (overseas or in S'pore), $65 per 4 hours thereafter (overseas)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a cash benefit for delay of the scheduled public conveyance due to any cause outside the insured's control. Payout based on actual arrival time vs scheduled arrival time.
Covers all causes of unexpected delays that are beyond your control.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 1 & Page 2, Travel Delay For All Risks Highlight

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a cash benefit if the insured person is denied boarding on a confirmed scheduled flight whilst overseas due to overbooking by the airline.

base_limits.basis: $100 for 1st full 6 hours, $65 per 4 hours thereafter

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a cash benefit for delay upon arrival at destination due to flight deviation caused by adverse weather or landing at an alternative destination for emergency medical treatment of a fellow passenger.
Pays a cash benefit for each full 12 consecutive hours of delay caused by the unlawful hijacking of the aircraft or public conveyance the insured person is travelling on.
Pays a cash benefit if pre-booked and paid hotel facilities are unavailable due to specified events like fire, flood, strike, etc.

Pays a cash benefit if the insured person fails to connect to a confirmed onward travel connection due to the late arrival of the incoming connecting public conveyance, and no alternative is available within 6 hours.
Pays a cash benefit for each full 48 consecutive hours the insured person is unlawfully detained against their will by kidnappers during the trip.

base_limits.type: Per Insured Person (In aggregate for the relevant Sections)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides cover for losses arising directly from an Act of Terrorism, subject to the aggregate limit, under the relevant benefit sections of the policy.
Extends the Personal Accident (Section 1) cover to include Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement if sustained as an innocent bystander due to war between nations or civil war.

base_limits.type: Per Insured Person (In aggregate for the relevant Sections)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides cover for losses arising from participation in specified leisure underwater activities (e.g., scuba diving under licensed instruction), subject to the aggregate limit, under the relevant benefit sections.
Pays a cash benefit if pre-booked accommodation is cancelled by the provider after the trip has commenced due to specified reasons (e.g., fire, flood, natural disaster).
Covers additional costs incurred for alternative travel arrangements if the original scheduled public transport is cancelled or delayed due to specified events (e.g., strike, riot, natural disaster).
Reimburses emergency telephone call charges incurred due to hospitalisation or a claimable event under the policy.
Covers the insurance excess or deductible amount that the insured person becomes legally liable to pay in respect of loss or damage to a rented vehicle.
Covers expenses for necessary reconstructive surgery, specifically skin transplantation, required as a result of accidental burns sustained during the trip.

coverages.coverage_name: Recuperation Allowance Due to Accidental Miscarriage

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a lump sum allowance if the insured person suffers an accidental miscarriage during the trip, provided the miscarriage is covered under Section 2 (Medical Expenses Overseas).

coverages.coverage_name: Quarantine Allowance Due to 17 Infectious Diseases Upon Return to Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily cash benefit if the insured person is required by a relevant authority to be quarantined in Singapore upon return due to suspected infection from one of the 17 specified infectious diseases (SARS, Dengue, vCJD, Nipah, Japanese Viral Encephalitis, Malaria, Pulmonary Tuberculosis, Measles, Rabies, Melioidosis, HFMD, Avian Flu (H1N1, H5N1, H9N2, H7N7, H7N9), Chikungunya, Mumps, Rubella, MERS, Zika).

base_limits.type: Loss or damage of golf equipment

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss/damage to owned golf equipment, celebration costs for a hole-in-one achieved during a competition, reimbursement of unused green fees due to covered reasons, and liability for damage to a rented golf buggy.

coverages.coverage_name: Free and Automatic Extension of Policy

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Policy coverage is automatically extended for up to 14 days if the return to Singapore is delayed beyond the policy end date due to injury, illness, quarantine, or delayed/cancelled public conveyance beyond the insured's control.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 2, Free and Automatic Extension of Policy Highlight

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: The policy includes coverage under relevant sections (e.g., Personal Accident, Medical Expenses) for participation in amateur sports including tandem air sports (skydiving, hang-gliding, paragliding), snow-skiing, hot-air ballooning, bungee jumping, indoor rock climbing, and trekking up to 3,500m above sea level for all mountains.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 1 & Page 2, Amateur Sports Cover Highlight
